meanings.definition: To shrink back, as in fear or disgust.
meanings.sent1: She cringed when she saw the spider crawling towards her.
meanings.sent2: He cringed away from the loud noise, covering his ears.
meanings.sent3: The cat cringed at the sight of the cucumber on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The thought of public speaking made her cringe with anxiety.
meanings.sent5: The child cringed at the idea of trying the unfamiliar food.

meanings.sent1: He cringed when he realized he had worn mismatched socks to the party.
meanings.sent2: She cringed at the memory of her awkward fall in front of everyone.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's bad joke made the audience cringe in sympathy.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's scolding made the student cringe with shame.
meanings.sent5: The teenager cringed as her parents shared embarrassing childhood stories.

meanings.definition: To react with distaste or aversion.
meanings.sent1: She cringed at the taste of the bitter medicine.
meanings.sent2: He cringed at the thought of having to clean up the mess.
meanings.sent3: The picky eater would cringe at the sight of vegetables on his plate.
meanings.sent4: The detective cringed as he uncovered the gruesome details of the crime scene.
meanings.sent5: The smell of rotten eggs made everyone cringe in disgust.
